We're growing and adding a Vice President, Technology Engineering. In this role, you will lead a large team of Developers, QA Engineers and DevOps in a fast paced, innovative environment. Reporting to the CTO, you'll lead the strategic direction, future road map and the overall execution and delivery of new and improved products. Who do you know for this fantastic opportunity?

Freedom Financial Network was recently named the #1 Best Place to Work in the Valley by the Phoenix Business Journal and has appeared multiple times on the Inc. 500 Fastest Growing Companies list. We're growing and adding 100's of roles each month as we prepare to move into our new, state of the art campus in Tempe in 2018. Leads a team of 5 Direct Reports and 30+ indirect reports. Built the Talent Acquisition (TA) strategy from scratch to support an organization growing from 3,000 employees to over 10,000 globally within 2 years. R1 RCM is the leader in healthcare revenue cycle outsourcing managing $3 billion in net patient revenue (NPR) with growth tracking to more than $9 billion in NPR by 2018.•	Developed the Talent Acquisition model to include business aligned Recruiting teams and a specialty Recruiting Operations, Branding & Sourcing team.•	Created and implemented a standard “6 Step Recruiting Process” to ensure a common approach and improved outcome to bringing new talent into the organization.•	Created the first Talent Acquisition Executive Advisory Board enlisting key executives and business heads to collaborate on Talent Acquisition related issues, solutions, decisions and communications. •	Implemented the first balanced scorecard for Talent Acquisition measuring key performance indicators around recruiting efficiency, effectiveness and operational performance. Improved time to hire by 37 days for salaried roles and 15 days for hourly roles, internal hires by 4100 basis points (41%) and reduced cost per hire by $2100 for salaried roles and $1,050 for hourly roles.•	Introduced the first hiring manager, candidate experience and quality of hire surveys as a way to gather data and feedback for continuous improvement of processes, recruiter performance and employment brand in the talent markets.•	Conducted a full process assessment to find efficiency gains resulting in the movement of some back office TA work to our India location and a cost savings of $200,000 annually.•	Saved the firm over $800,000 in the first year by reducing reliance on outside search firms. •	Implemented an employment brand strategy to include a new careers website, social media channels and content, campus strategy, CRM tool, Employee Referral Program, and a local community integration strategy.

Led a team consisting of 75+ highly talented Recruiting professionals, whom offer support that spans across the entire Schwab enterprise of more than 14,000 employees, also known as “Schwabbies”. This position was responsible for creating and executing a firm wide talent acquisition strategy which included:~Overseeing all aspects of recruiting talent into Charles Schwab including workforce planning, the creation and execution of sourcing and selection programs which are designed to help meet the complex and evolving demands for talent, managing the employment brand as well as the hiring manager and candidate experience in all markets. ~Overseeing the development of a team of Talent Advisors and TA Leaders who support our business partners and providing oversight of regulatory reporting/process requirements as required.~Building the required infrastructure, functions and workflow to help attract, support, and retain Sales, Service, Operations, Technology, Compliance, Corporate Functions and Management professionals.
Manager, Talent Acquisition for PayPal Global Operations

Led a team of 15 direct reports and 16 indirect reports encompassing the Americas, Europe and Asia Pacific regions. Led the overall strategy and execution of talent acquisition for PayPal Operations with over 3,400 requisitions filled annually.•	Developed a structured recruitment framework globally to enhance quality of hire, candidate experience, hiring manager experience and on time delivery of talent to the business.•	Created and implemented various recruiting tools to include screening documents, Lominger competency interview guides, “day in the life” scenarios, realistic job previews, and skill testing.•	 Partnered with Workforce Planning to create a scalable rhythm of forecasting hire plans, delivery dates and appropriate lead times in order to meet the needs of the business while ensuring the success of the Talent Acquisition team.•        Successfully partnered with business leaders and COE’s to plan and execute the opening of new Operations centers in Chandler, Berlin, Kuala Lumpur, and Sao Paulo in 2010/ 2011. Achieved 100% of the initial hire plans on time in each site. •	Created and managed the recruitment budget for PayPal Global Operations on an annual basis. •	Created a quarterly balanced scorecard focused on recruiting metrics, customer and client satisfaction scores and financial data.  Develop and present quarterly talent acquisition readouts to the Sr. VP and other business leaders.•	Reduced global costs per hire by 27% YOY and reduced agency usage by 6 percentage points YOY saving the company over $700,000.•	Delivered to the goal of 97% on time hires in 2011.•	Exceeded the source of hire goals for both internal hiring and employee referrals.•	Partnered with business leaders to analyze short term attrition globally and to create strategic initiatives that resulted in a 13 percentage point reduction within three quarters time frame.

Managed the operations of 6 nursing branches of this nationwide medical staffing company encompassing a $22 million budget.•	P&L responsibility for operations in Fresno, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Denver, Seattle and Phoenix offices.•	Achieved 20% revenue growth as a region compared to industry results of -28% in an economic downturn in 2009.•	Increased gross profit by 200 basis points across the region in 2009.•	Achieved 110% of Operating Income budget in 2009 and grew OI by 72.9% YOY.•	Three (3) time 100+ club winner for both the Nursing and Allied divisions. •	Maintained 86% retention of internal staff.•	Hired, trained and coached over 30 internal employees, 6 of which went on to win 100+ club multiple times.•	Hired, trained and coached 5 of the top 10 Recruiting Managers within the entire company (top 3%).•	Led  the first 2 recruiting managers in the company to achieve formal certification and thereby receiving a promotion to Senior Market Manager level.•	Maintained an average Client Expert Opinions score of 45+ and Talent Expert Opinions score of 55+ which is considered “excellent” within the Net Promoter scoring system across all industries and as compared to the staffing industry average score of -16. •	Selected as a trainer for company-wide new hire training and annual management training.•	Created strategic market plans around business development, recruitment and retention for all markets. •	Ensured quality and Joint Commission compliancy with all nurse and client files. Obtained 100% Joint Commission certification in all 5 offices applied for.•	Sold two (2) full Acute Care hospital Managed Service Provider (MSP) programs at the “C” level generating over $4 million dollars in revenue. These were the first acute care MSP contracts for Supplemental Health Care.•	Participated in writing large RFP’s with an approximate 80% success rate of winning medium and large contracts.•

March 21, 2016, Frank managed Heather directly

Heather is a strong leader with experience in all facets of recruitment from building sourcing strategies to candidate selection methodologies.  She is a team player and knowledgeable about HR practices and business functions.  She demonstrated patience and understanding when faced with competing priorities.  She built a strong following of people who saw her as a wonderful manager and always placed the interests of candidates and employees above her own. Her innovative ideas, ongoing encouragement and positive, supportive communication style helped accelerate the careers of many who worked for her. She displayed emotional intelligence which helped her build great relationships and I enjoyed my time working with her.

Heather joined PayPal as a project manager for our Chandler, AZ CS Operations site build out. We needed to take the site from 0 to 1,000 employees!  She led the kick off of the TA efforts in Chandler and was extremely successful in her marketing efforts (we always had a line out the door at every event!). She did such a great job that we offered her the leadership role to drive the CS Operations hiring across the globe. Any employee sitting in our very large Chandler PP office today is due to Heather's ability to build an effective recruitment team. Heather's stand out strengths include project management, execution, data-driven and very timely decision making, highly action-oriented, etc. She is very delivery focused and has been a great partner to me as I lead the non-CS related teams. She is a great peer coach and partner!

summary: Heather Marcom is a seasoned Talent Acquisition leader with over 18 years encompassing a variety of industries including financial services, information technology, healthcare and customer service related fields. Currently, Heather leads Talent Acquisition for Freedom Financial Network. Previously, Heather directly led the Talent Acquisition and Talent Attraction efforts for R1 RCM, Charles Schwab and PayPal Global Operations.
